Cell.Data: An unlikely survivor of Crimson Keep, you return to the city of Stormfall with a new ambition; to find the dragon matriarch Oshara before anyone else can.
{Is that really him?|Is that really her?}
It canât be. No one survived Crimson Keep.
Weâve been waiting for ages. Why do they get to cut through the line?
From what I can tell, theyâre an order of knights dispatched from Archion. Of diplomatic importance, and all that, hence the priority treatment.
Even Damaskus wouldnât make us wait this long. Our requests arenât making it past the door. Somethingâs got to give.
If itâs not the Order of Oshara, itâs some convention of the Great Houses. Theyâll always have an excuse not to deal with us.
Back! All of you! The Council is NOT seeing anyone today. Come back with your grievances another time!
As long as it takes! Now step back!
I need an audience with the Council.
As Iâve said a thousand times. The Council is not seeing anyone today. They have more urgent matters to attend to.
Theyâll want to hear what I have to say.
Thunderblade. Do you not recognise your Champion?
Champion? Itâs you? I had no idea. My deepest apologies. The Council would never deny you an audience, not after all youâve done for us.
Alright, enough gushing. Step aside, now.
My name is Zalahir, Champion. Military advisor to the Council. What brings you here? Rumour had it you died at Crimson Keep.
Not quite. My enemies came close. But my strength remains.
What of your family? When you left you were looking for them?
{Oh theyâre fine. Perfectly safe. Theyâre busy... preparing something.|Oh theyâre fine. Perfectly safe. Theyâre busy... preparing something.}

{As of right now, though, I need to talk to the Council. Itâs imperative that we help the Order of Oshara.|As of right now, though, I need to talk to the Council. Itâs imperative that we help the Order of Oshara.}
Well, good luck with that. Theyâve been debating it for days now. The Great Houses canât seem to come to an agreement.
Maybe you can talk some sense into them. Head on inside.
We canât waste another day. The more time we spend navigating your bureaucracy, the less likely it is that weâll ever find her.
Iâm sympathetic to your concerns, gentlemen. But we are accountable to the Great Houses, just as youâre accountable to your elders.
You think this is about accountability? The only reason we know Osharaâs alive is because this place isnât a smoking ruin yet!
Quiet, Ilthain! Thatâs beyond the scope of this conversation.
We recognise youâre in a difficult position. But I regret to say we have yet to reach a consensus with the Great Houses.
One moment. I want to speak with the Order of Oshara. What brings you all to Stormfall?

{Ondar, wait. Iâve met this man. He helped me hunt Sirkis down. You know, that Svriir attacking the southern anchor?|Ondar, wait. Iâve met this woman. She helped me hunt Sirkis down. You know, that Svriir attacking the southern anchor?}
So it is! Our champion, returned to us at last. Bad tidings came from Crimson Keep. We were hardly expecting you to return.
But somehow, here I am. Iâve come to ensure that the Orderâs demands are met. What do you need from the Diamond Council?
Itâs about our matriarch, Oshara. The one I told you about, the mother of all our drakes. Sheâs gone missing.
Indeed. And we donât have the numbers to carry out a thorough search on our own. Hence, our presence here.
Perhaps we havenât made ourselves clear. If we stepped out of line to help you, we would be stripped of our titles before you saw the shadow of an alliance.
Itâs true. Our hands are tied in this matter.
No, not completely. We could lean on the scales by selecting a temporary head of state. Someone not partisan to any existing house. Someone with the good will of the people.
Well, actually... Consider that the Champion has something we lack: the respect of noble and commoner alike.
Not to mention, the public would finally feel safe again. We remain in dangerous times ever since the Svriir crisis.
But will the other Great Houses allow it?
They fear the mounting wrath of the people as much as we do. They may be amenable to selecting a Regent.
True as that may be, first we must assemble their representatives. We cannot transfer executive power without their consent.
Come back later in the afternoon, Champion. We will update you on the Housesâ decision then.
Weâre not clear yet. But if youâre going to help us, we should tell you whatâs at stake. Not here. Letâs talk outside.
I would have preferred not to delve into matters of state, but here we areâ¦
I heard what you said, before. About the city crumbling without Oshara. Care to elaborate, now weâre alone?
I will. Just know that some of this may seem abstract or fantastical to you.
Trust me, Iâm used to it.
Oshara is a seal between our world and the labyrinth called Naedre which connects multiple planes. She and Naedre, together, bind us to the Realms of Law, of Dreams, of Death, and Oblivion.
If Oshara dies, the seals between this realm and the labyrinth will break. Chaos will ensue.
And thatâs what you think your enemies want? To break the seals? To shatter all order?
Osharaâs a powerful being. Thereâs no telling what they might get from her.
Which is why we should waste no time finding her.
We have had reports of drakes in the Wilds near Stormfall. Osharaâs progeny, we believe.
They may hold the key to finding her, but they havenât been seen airborne for days now, and the tree cover makes it impossible for us to establish any leads.
Weâve asked the Council for Stormfallâs help, but as youâve seen, that hasnât amounted to much.
Speaking of, I believe I see them waiting for you.
Right. Iâll leave you now, and go fetch my crown.
Good luck. Itâs gonna be weird calling you âRegentâ if the Council comes through.
Yes, this will be in the cityâs best interest. What a stroke of good fortune.
{Ah! There he is, the Regent-elect. Please, join us.|Ah! There she is, the Regent-elect. Please, join us.}
Did the âGreat Housesâ see sense, then?
Weâre happy to say that they did. We were up all night discussing your proposal. Many of the other Houses were, predictably, uncertain at first.
But thankfully, everyone sees the sense in granting you temporary powers. You are the perfect candidate. The vote was passed unanimously in the early hours of the afternoon.
Good. Now let the Order know that Stormfall will provide the resources they need to find their Matriarch.
Weâve already ordered Guard Captain Zalahir to assemble a council attending to the Orderâs needs. You may join the drake knights there at your earliest convenience.
But first, we should make it official. We were thinking a coronation. A day of celebration to mark your ascendancy.
I care nothing for pomp and ceremony right now. I must move quickly if I am to - if we are to help the Order.
But it would do wonders for public perception. Everyone should know that their Champion now watches over them. It will calm their nerves.
{An unnecessary expense and a waste of time. Please, put it out of your mind.|An unnecessary expense and a waste of time. Put it out of your mind.}
Such is your prerogative. We understand, of course. Tabbitha will learn her place in time, I assure you.
If you wish to organise our efforts with the Order of Oshara, I recommend you speak to Zalahir in the marketplace.
Heâll brief you on how to begin allocating resources to projects in the city. Helping the Order will be one such project, of course, but you may wish to begin others.
My priority is finding the Matriarch, but I will consider the rest.
I have to get to the palace.
Donât go near that place. Run while you still can. Run!
Would you really choose oblivion over family?
Thereâs still time. We bring peace: embrace it.
Youâre staring a hole through my face, Ascended.
Gernese?! I saw you dead. Your body... it was in the palace. I was just there a moment ago.
Settle down. Youâve been on quite the journey. How do you feel? Do you still sense his influence at all?

The Helion wasnât enough to prevent his return at Crimson Keep. And as he rose, he took you, Valeria, and the Grand Inquisitor as his thralls. I was able to track you down when he sent you to Stormfall but, no such luck with your father and sister.
Theyâre at Ahrimanâs side. I saw it, or I think I did. They scourged Stormfall alongside him.
You saw it? You mean you had a vision?
No. It wasnât a vision. I was there, body and soul. I saw him having invaded the palace, father and Valeria at his side. And there was an eggâ¦
An egg? You saw Ahriman follow Osharaâs egg to Stormfall?!
This... might be difficult to hear.
Ahriman used you to advance his plans. To abuse the trust of the people of Stormfall and their allies.

Itâs likely The Order of Oshara will be able to tell you more. But in short, Ahriman seeks control of a creature known as the Voice of Naedre. He sent you here to offer the Order your help, as a pretext for gaining access to her.

Circumstances led to the first Voice of Naedreâs demise. But she bore an egg before her death, which will match her in power one day. I was able to prevent you -- prevent Ahriman -- from seizing it.
Circumstances? Did I kill the first Voice of Naedre?
That matters little. The egg is safe for now. I had it sent to the palace. The young Oshara Knight must be looking over it as we speak.
But your vision is right about one thing at least: Ahriman wants the egg. And I doubt heâll stop at anything to get it. Even an act of open warfare.
Go speak to the council about raising the defences: weâll need to fortify the city. Take care to omit any details about your possession or about this strange vision.
I will. Thank you, Gernese. For freeing me, and for believing me.
Did you get a closer look at the ship?
Couldnât get close. There were guards in the way.
But Iâm sure of it. Damaskus is back.
Itâs nonsense. Leaving Damaskus alive is a loose end. I canât see the Council risking that.
But what if he is back? What if he puts the Council in its place? Donât you like the thought of that?
I saw him myself, approaching the palace under heavy guard.
If he really has returned, heâs more of a fool than I thought.
You have everything to gain if we believe you. Are we supposed to take your word for it?
You donât have to take my word. Send a scouting party! Verify my claims!
Thereâs no need. Not one of our daily patrols has reported signs of cultist activity. And we have no obligation to spend precious resources on your whim. This isnât your town anymore.

Who cares about your resources! Youâre on the chopping block, each and every one of you. And all your pride, your interests, your Great Houses, theyâll drag down every last innocent in Stormfall along with you.
But please, dig your heels down. Leave it up to the nobility. One final failure for the record.
Regent! Weâd heard word of your arrival. Welcome back. We have an unexpected guest, as you can see.
He will not bother us any longer. Weâll have him escorted out.
Disregard that order. I can vouch for Damaskusâ claims.
Something is coming for Stormfall. And when it gets here, itâll make the Svriir and the mist look like trifles.
We need to fortify. We need to recruit. And we need every ally we can possibly get.
You cannot be serious. Allowing Damaskus back into Stormfall would undermine your authority as Regent. Not to mention ours as a Council.
The incoming attack would undermine us a lot more. We can worry about internal politics later, but this is the moment to make a show of unity.
You can count on me, Champion. I wonât fail Stormfall again.
Now to my purpose here. A package was sent to the palace. Where is it now?
You speak of the egg? It is currently displayed in the throne room. Take care with it, Regent. Our relations with the city of Archion depend on that bauble.
Meanwhile, we will raise this emergency gathering. Thunderblade Zalahir will take you there once you are ready.
A lotâs resting on you, sprout. Wonder if you can feel it already.
When you didnât come back, part of me hoped Oshara was still alive. Er, not that I wanted you dead instead.
Oh. Right then. The fight with Oshara... This must be the new Voice of Naedre?
Youâre the one who brought it back. Are you alright?

Iâve had a harrowing time of it. Gerneseâs help was... sorely needed. But itâs over now. At least I think it is. And Iâd like to piece things back together. Including figuring out what the Voice of Naedre does, exactly.
Well, it tethers us to the other realms. Without a Voice of Naedre, the laws that bind us, our ability to dream, even our ability to die, all that would fade away.
And if the Voice of Naedre fell into Ahrimanâs hands, he would take control of every single one of those domainsâ¦

Heâs a Fallen Primordial whoâs, uh, taken an interest in Aelwa. In the egg. My friend Gernese was able to stop him from taking her. He... well... Thereâs no doubt in my mind that heâs going to try again.
Aelwa... Blasted cults. Does this never end? Was taking Oshara not enough?
Thereâs something else I need to know. The Voice of Naedre. Has it ever... this will sound stupid. Has it ever given someone a second chance? The opportunity to try again after dying?
What on earth are you saying? That youâve been brought back from the dead?
Itâs more than that. I feel like I was shown a path that led to oblivion, then I was pulled back to a fork in the road. And I donât know who to thank for it.
Thereâs no record of Oshara ever bringing anyone back from the dead, or of her turning back the tides... If there was, how could she have let herself die?
Maybe her daughter is different. I donât know. Somethingâs happened to me. And so far, sheâs the only lead I have.

Letâs just set that aside for now. What we know for sure is that sheâs the Voice of Naedre, and that Primordial Whatshisface is after her. All we can do is put as many obstacles as possible between him and her.
Call on me if you need help. Meanwhile, Iâll be watching over, ah, Aelwa. Call me paranoid, but I donât plan on letting her out of my sight for a while.
Good call. Ahriman is a... devious enemy. Trust your own instinct, Ilthain, and nobody elseâs. Not even mine.
Thereâs no time to waste. I should speak to Zalahir. Heâll show me to the emergency gathering.
Youâre staring a hole through my face, Ascended.
Huh... Gernese? Are we back from the Sunken Lands?
We are. Settle down. Youâve been on quite the journey. How do you feel? Do you still sense his influence at all?
No, itâs just that... Iâve heard this before. Weâve returned from the Sunken Lands once before. Weâve spoken here, in this very location. As though time had... well, repeated.

Twice already, Iâve seen Ahriman launch an attack on Stormfall. He unites the Covenant and marches on the city, and invariably, I die in battle only to wake up... here. At Stormfallâs gates, with you.
You take a very casual perspective on your own death, Ascended. Are you well? These may be the fever dreams you endured under Ahrimanâs possession.

Are you willing to bet on that? You told me so yourself in another life: you stood between Ahriman and the egg. You know he wants control over the Voice of Naedre, and you know what heâs willing to do to get it.
You speak true. Ahriman wonât give up on the egg now that Osharaâs dead. And if he cannot win by guile, we must suspect that he will try to win by force.
Look, I hate to rush this, I know itâs a lot to take in, but I have to go convince the Council to prepare. Iâve done it once before, so how hard could it be the second time?

I wonât get in your way, if time is really repeating for you. Just be careful. You donât know whether this phenomenon will perpetuate infinitely, or whether the cycle will have consequences for our world.
Donât be rash in your decisions. Any mistakes you make could be final.
Of course. I donât plan on standing by while Ahriman wins over and over.
Iâve alerted the Council. Now, itâs time to weaken the Covenant while we still can.
Everyoneâs onboard. Time to deal with Ahrimanâs cronies.
Easy does it. I just need to learn from my mistakes. Study Ahrimanâs weaknesses.
All of Stormfall is on my side. I canât let them down.
Another death, another life. I have to keep trying.
How many times do I have to die to end this nightmare?
If I have to convince the council again, I might give up on this whole thing.
They trust me. They all trust me so much. If they knew how little I actually deserve itâ¦
If the world wonât let me die, guess itâs up to me to pay it forward.
Right. Rally our allies. Fortify the town. Attack Ahrimanâs reinforcements. Then wash, rinse, repeat.
I canât just keep doing the same thing; There has to be something I can do to change the outcome.
Beat them back into the sewers! Donât cede them an inch!
{Mylord! A message from Eos Gernese.|Milady! A message from Eos Gernese.}
Ahriman has opened portals at each axis of Stormfall. Heâs flanking us.
All our forces are mobilised near the sewers, and we cannot weaken our position.
Got it. Then itâs all up to me. Catch your breath, Zalahir. Iâll deal with the portals.
Weâve done all we can. Sleep now, Dervain.
The Sleeperâs thralls are flooding from that portal. Weâll be overwhelmed if I donât destroy it.
The Champion of Stormfall! We were expecting you, but not alone. Even you canât hope to hold this city by yourself.
You stand your ground remarkably. When your fight is done, youâll make an excellent agent for the Sleeper.
Every single body that falls today will feed our numbers. Do you think you can match those odds?
All lives rest in the Sleeperâs arms eventually. None can escape it. Not even you.
They do like to talk, donât they?
And hereâs the source of the Aberrantâs creations. Charming as always.
The Lambach sends its salutations, Ascended. We will conjure plentiful wonders from Stormfallâs flesh.
Let us mould your finite shell into something more expansive.
Do you not long for control? Do you not yearn for the unbound possibilities of your body?
We are one yet many. As long as any part of us remains, we will rise again. Do you not understand?!
Weâre safe from another Cordanon for now.
Those burns will heal in time. Youâll live.
Donât say that. The battleâs not over yet-- Aagh, that stings.
Ahrimanâs servants. I need to cut off their path into the city.
This one defected from the Blind Prince. Punish him for his treachery, then move on to our target.
Set your weapons down and join our ranks once again. We will forgive you.
The Blind Prince offers the end to all the strife that plagues humanity! Your struggle is meaningless.
Impressive. But youâre fighting on the wrong front, Ascended.
Iâm tired of dealing with your lackeys, Ahriman.
Whatâs going on now? Where are the rest of his forces? Whatever Ahrimanâs playing at, I donât like it.
All major entrances are clear. Whatâs our status?
The situation has stabilised on the lower levels. For now. But no sign of Ahriman.
We should take a moment to reinforce the barricades and check on the last evacuees.
That came from the palace. Letâs hurry!
Eos! Enemy reinforcements are closing in from all sides!
You know what this means. Ahriman is making his move. Weâll hold his army at the marketplace and bottleneck them at the exits. Hurry to the palace now. Go!
Letâs get it right, this time.
Ready or not, Aelwa is waiting for me.
Deep breaths. Remember everything youâve learned since last time.
No matter what, I have to keep standing up to him.
I think Iâm getting the hang of this... I hope.
Come on... we learn from our mistakesâ¦
Iâm so sick of seeing his face. Letâs make sure todayâs the last time.
We can do it. For Valeria.
Please canât it be over already? Would be nice, wouldnât it? If the Covenant would just call it off and go home.
How many more times do I have to do this?!
The Voice of Naedre has eluded me once. It wonât happen again.
Do not trifle with me. You cannot fathom how little stands between you and the unmaking of all you know.
I have seen your mind. I can mimic every facet of your power.
Quash them if you can; they will only rise again.
This egg is bound to realms far more dangerous than your own. Who will stand to protect Wolcen from those dangers if not I?
Youâre beginning to outnumber yourself, Ascended.
What are you fighting for? For Stormfall? A haven of corrupt plutocrats which has long outlived its past glory.
Or perhaps youâre fighting for family? But what will remain of those filial bonds when all this is over?
The Primordials blessed you with such potential! If only you knew what to do with it.
It seems my soldiers cannot get the best of you. Admirable. If only I could have kept you as a thrall.
Perhaps youâll be more receptive to your family. Theyâve missed you, Ascended. You should hear their pleas.
Donât expect a recurrence of our last fight. The Blind Prince is with us now: Iâll show you the power He brings.
I never betrayed you. I never misled you. I am exactly the man I was the first day I brought you into my home. Understand this: Ahriman was with us the entire time.
I never sought to hurt you. I still donât.

{Itâs our last chance to be a family. To do right by one another. Please, my son, set your weapons aside.|Itâs our last chance to be a family. To do right by one another. Please, my daughter, set your weapons aside.}
Your own father. Youâve grown cruel.
Shut up. Itâs not over yet. I can save him.
AnathÃ«a. You purged Ahrimanâs shackles from my soul. Please, I ask for your favour once more on behalf of my father. Free him.
Whatever psalms you mutter, they cannot make it right: youâve cut your father down. Youâve killed him.
Now, Ascended. Will you turn your blade against your sister as easily as you did your father?
Whatâs the matter? You slaughtered hundreds of me in Cordanon. Why flinch now?
Iâve come to terms with fatherâs betrayal. With Edricâs. But I never thought Iâd have to endure it from you.
Youâre really going to kill me with your own hands? Why?! Why is it that everyone I know and love is willing to sacrifice me for some vague and corrupt greater good?!
She trusted you even to the end. A pity.
Do you find this fun? This âplayacting"?
Of course! Why wouldnât it be, with an audience this receptive?
Come on... Wake up, Valeria. Kick that bastard out.
I hate to see a family torn apart. I will give you one last chance to respect their wishes, Ascended. Face to face.
You fear change just like AnathÃ«a and her ilk. You refuse to see the ends through the means.
I was humanityâs greatest ally. I would have shared power untold had she not stood in my way. And you side with her. You luxuriate in your chains. Pitiful.
I will confess to being impressed. At every turn youâve been unyielding. But no longer.
I see it now. You could never find your place in the world I am to build.
Curse me, hate me, anything you want. But please, donât shut me out completely.
Are you sure you want to hear what I have to say?
I am. Anything, so I might answer for myself.
I donât want you to answer for yourself. I want you gone. Do you hear me? I never want our paths to cross again.
You said it yourself. âNo giving up on family.â Is that not true anymore?
Stop. You canât claim those words. Not after turning Edric against us. Not after ordering me to abandon Valeria.
And not after cleaving off my arm. Ahriman was there from the beginning, wasnât he? Even the day you adopted us. He might have more of a claim to fatherhood than you have.
Iâm sure he would love to hear that.
Heâs in the Abyss now. And you should consider yourself lucky we didnât send you after him.
I recognise that reaction. Just like... oh no.
Valeriaâs leaving any second now. I should make sure everyoneâs there to see her off.
If Iâm honest, Iâm sort of relieved itâs gone.
Regent. Might I have a moment?
Eos, please. Stay put a moment and catch your breath.
Iâve done enough resting. The world wonât wait for me to be well.
Itâs just for an afternoon. You be good to the Regent, alright?
Glad I could catch you before you left. How is the Tempest II?
Ready for launch, though not as ready as Iâd hoped. I fear thereâs little to be done about it. If we wait any longer, the currents will be unnavigable.
What do you hope to find across the ocean?
With any luck? We find the original Tempest. I saw it as a boy, Champion. It really was the peak of our navy. We would be returning an unfathomable treasure to its home.
And if a miracle intervenes, who knows? Perhaps weâll reach uncharted land of our own. After all, the Tempest was an exploration vessel.
I wish you good fortune, then. Stormfall will be waiting for your return.
Donât flatter me. With all youâve done for the city, the people will be happy if your regency lasts a lifetime.
But the Council wonât make things easy for you. Take good care of Stormfall. And donât make the same mistakes I did.
I am sorry to bother you, Regent. I know you must be busy with your sisterâs departure.
Why so nervous? With that tone Iâd expect Ahriman to be knocking at our door again.
Far from that. Itâs about your father.
The innkeeper passed a letter to the guard. The Grand Inquisitor paid his stay and left early this morning.
Couldnât say goodbye face to faceâ¦
He gave no indication as to his destination. He only asks that you do not follow him, my lord.
Should I send out a search party?
Should I send out a search party?
I think weâll need more subtle means than that. Hold off on any search party for now. Iâll give it some thought and come back to you.

{Very well, mylord. Let me know if you change your mind. Meanwhile, Iâll ensure the coast is clear for your sisterâs departure.|Very well, Milady. Let me know if you change your mind. Meanwhile, Iâll ensure the coast is clear for your sisterâs departure.}
How are your wounds treating you, Gernese?
My wounds are all people seem to ask about. It appears Iâm the only one who remembers that weâve lost half our holdings and a generationâs worth of soldiers.
Which crisis is calling for your heroic intervention this time?
Laugh if you will, but Valeria was the reason for my presence.
We will need hands to rebuild the Brotherhood. New recruits too. And Iâd much rather see her in our community than wandering aimlessly.
And let me guess: a hard no?
Intercede with her, Ascended. She is choosing solitude when the darkness hounds her most. If not the Brotherhood, convince her to stay in Stormfall. For her own good.
I will do my best. Iâd also rather she were surrounded with friends, but as things are, I canât blame her for wanting to put some distance between herself and the past.
I understand that. But try all the same. If anyone can sway her, itâs you.
Now, this is a rare sight. You, without Aelwa trailing behind your boots?
I had to leave her back at the palace. Aeldor needed my attention, today. Itâs been a while since anyone borrowed him. Not since I lent him to the whelps, Iâd wager.
Thatâs how we called the junior initiates. The Order of Oshara always was a cruel place.
I assume you wonât be taking Aelwa back there?
If I donât, the Order will crumble. No matriarch, no new dragons, no nothing. But... well, maybe thatâs for the best.
Oshara saw potential in them once, even if they squandered it over time. Maybe you could start something new. Wipe the slate clean and begin again with Aelwa.
Canât say I havenât thought about it. Of a new order, where no one was guaranteed status by way of nobility.
One where our equipment wasnât funded by slavers. Where our drakes were more than beasts of burden.
Then why not do it? You have a matriarch. You have the support of one of the seven jewels of the Concordat. And you know the dangers that await Aelwa better than anyone.

This power you wield. It is not yours to command.

%1: {Sheâs under his hold! Kill her!|Sheâs under his hold! Kill her!}

Ondar â my father â is dead. Oshara is lost â who knows whatâs going to happen to Naedre now. And me, I â I canât go back â

And now, that power may as well be in Ashtarothâs hands. Is that any better?

No, we canât be sure what happens if Oshara dies. But if she lives, we know with absolute certainty that she will roam, killing thousands in her wake.

You werenât always like this. When I met you, you were afraid. Fumbling. Worried for your family.
I donât see the point of discussing this. Have you thought about our next step?
I canât just leave thousands to die. Not for the sake of some legend that none of us really understand.
If I can find some way to save her, I will. Trust me, I gain nothing from her death.
But sheâs flying free. How are we meant to find her?
Sheâs hungry for flesh. No doubt sheâll leave a trail. Iâll ask Zalahir to gather reports from the countryside.
Tell him to look for a den. Osharaâs been ripped from her home, from her children. Sheâll be looking for some place she feels safe.
Good idea. Iâll pass it on.
At last. I donât think I could have humored these dullards for a second longer. Now, letâs follow the ashesâ¦
Sounds like Iâm not the only one on the hunt.
Such power. And it could have been mine, without Ashtarothâs greed in the way.
Speak to me, Voice of Naedre. Resist Ashtarothâs corruption and join your power to mine.
What a waste. He has rotted you through and through.
Incubation pods? So, Ashtaroth hasnât renounced his claim to Oshara. Fool. Iâll see to his punishment soon enough.
I should kill his recruitment effort in the crib.
You and your worshippers will regret the day you were conjured.
Tch. The Republican warmongers. They must see the value of a good weapon in Oshara.
Sheâs beyond their control now, but I have to make sureâ¦
Youâre of no more use to me alive.
Sheâs determined... but why? What is she protecting?
Look at them, all, fighting over the right to wield her... I weep to think of her used for petty conquest.
They almost had her then... No time to waste. I should be the one to end her.
If youâd only bind yourself to me, I would silence the call of flesh and blood! You would be free!

Iâll say. Theyâre more desperate than I thought.
I hate to interrupt, but we have work to do.
Ondar, Ilthain. Whatâs the current state of your investigation?
The drakes were last seen in the wilds south of Stormfall. Weâve tried to locate them ourselves, but our numbers are small, the wilds vast, and the tree cover thick.

As I said. Finding Oshara is my top priority. Iâll come find you when we have news.
Our operations in the Wilds have proven fruitful. {Mâlord|Mâlady}. Weâve pinpointed the location of the drakes; if you gather the Order, we can talk on it in more detail.
{Mylord|Milady}, our scouts have returnedâ¦ It seems the Republic has set up camp in the Wilds. Theyâ¦ have drakes under their control.

Letâs not waste any more time, then. Ilthain, you and I will fly ahead to their encampment. Weâll scout their defences and devise a plan of attack.

And under the circumstances, the city should be manned to its fullest capacity. I will deal with Oshara alone.

Ezaneal sought to accomplish the impossible task: cancel out polarity.

Day and night he toiled, digging, heating, welding any and all materials he could set his hand on. A towering peak made of the purest shiganite.
One shell to end it all

Bound by the Fury, those crushing powers converging to Stormfall had effects way beyond what was humanly comprehensible: corrupted artefacts began to appear; weapons, armours, and other instruments of death started to fuse with magic itself. Bound by the Fury, the allpower of the Enneracts imbues all.
